Aston Martin V8 Vantage S 0-60 times

Autotk.com offers accurate information on Aston Martin V8 Vantage S 0-60 times and quarter mile from trusted sources. You may also keep track of how 0-60 times of Aston Martin V8 Vantage S changed across years and check out the model’s competitors with the same acceleration performance.

Our mission is to present an easy-to-read and comprehensive information on Aston Martin V8 Vantage S 0-60 mph and quarter mile for the devoted geeks, as it is an essential indicator of the vehicle power.

Aston Martin V8 Vantage S competitors' 0-60 mph acceleration

  • Porsche 911 0-60

    • 0-60 2.5 - 4.8 sec
    • quarter mile 10.6 @ 132 - 13.3 @ 107 mph

  • Audi R8 0-60

    • 0-60 2.9 - 3.3 sec
    • quarter mile 10.9 @ 130 - 11.5 @ 125 mph

  • McLaren 650S 0-60

    • 0-60 2.9 sec
    • quarter mile 10.5 @ 136 mph

  • Dodge Viper 0-60

    • 0-60 3 - 3.5 sec
    • quarter mile 11.3 @ 127 - 11.5 @ 125 mph

  • Nissan GT-R 0-60

    • 0-60 3.3 sec
    • quarter mile 11.6 @ 120 mph

It might be difficult to reproduce official Aston Martin V8 Vantage S 0-60 times driving your own car, as measuring accuracy of Aston Martin V8 Vantage S acceleration from 0 to 60 depends on the transmission type or such variables as wind, weather conditions, tire traction or even weight of the rim. For the safety of the public, 0-60 times are often recorded by professional drivers on the closed racing tracks or dragstrips.

The good news is you can always soup up your car to have the best drag times. The easiest way is chip-tuning. The Engine of Aston Martin V8 Vantage S is equipped with an engine management system (EMS)/Engine Control Unit (ECU) which can be modified to different settings, producing different performance levels and boosting V8 Vantage S\'s horsepower.

Right now we are well on course to post the data on transmission and engine on the Aston Martin V8 Vantage S acceleration page of our website. We also have plans to make it possible for any visitor of the website to add their own custom data on Aston Martin V8 Vantage S acceleration.
